story:
Once upon a time, in a beautiful village in Thailand, there was a kind and gentle little boy named Lek. Lek lived with his parents and his older sister, in a small house near the lush green rice fields. He loved to explore the fields, playing with the butterflies and watching the birds fly high in the sky.

One day, Lek found a tiny, abandoned bird's nest in the rice fields. He was curious and decided to take it home to care for it. He gathered some soft feathers, cotton, and thread to make a comfortable bed for the baby birds. Every day, Lek would go to the fields to find food for the baby birds, he would bring them delicious grubs, insects, and berries.

With Lek's kindness and care, the baby birds started to grow stronger and healthier. He named them Kai and Kratae, after his two best friends in the village. Days turned into weeks, and the baby birds started to fly around in the house, chirping happily.

One sunny morning, Lek knew it was time for Kai and Kratae to fly back to their home in the wild. He took them to the top of a nearby hill and gently nudged them out of the nest. At first, Kai and Kratae were scared, but with a little encouragement from Lek, they flapped their wings and soared high up in the sky.

Lek watched as his dear friends flew away, and he felt a sense of joy and pride that he helped them to grow and to be free. He knew that they would always be his friends, even if he couldn't see them anymore.

And so, Lek understood the true meaning of kindness and care. From that day on, he made it his mission to help anyone in need and to always be a good friend.

As Lek closed his eyes and drifted off to sleep, he felt content and happy. He knew that tomorrow was another day to explore, learn, and help those around him.

Goodnight my dear child, sweet dreams. May you always be as kind and caring as Lek.
